intro: Eriocaulon tenue, commonly known as slender threadgrass, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. This species typically grows in wet, marshy environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help it spread through vegetative propagation. Eriocaulon tenue plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetlands and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
